Authors:
V Kumaresan, C Sariha, Thokur Sreepathy Murali, G
Senthilarasu
Title: Occurrence of gilled fungi in Puducherry, southern India
Abstract:
Thirty three species of gilled-fungi belonging to 23
genera and 14 families were recorded from Puducherry, southern India.
The members of the family Agaricaceae were dominant and represented by
eight species followed by Psathyrellaceae (5 species), Lyophyllaceae and
Marasmiaceae (3 species each), Hymenograstraceae, Pleurotaceae,
Pluteaceae and Polyporaceae (2 species each) and Biannulariaceae,
Bolbitiaceae, Omphalotaceae, Schizophyllaceae, Strophariaceae and
Tricholomataceae (1 species each). Fourteen species of agarics are new
reports from Puducherry. The species Chlorophyllum rhacodes,
Lactocollybia epia, Leucoagaricus meleagris and Schizophyllum commune
were widely distributed. Phylogenetic relationships of the abundant
species C. rhacodes, L. epia and L. meleagris were inferred by Maximum
Likelihood method.
